document.heading: District of Columbia Government Comprehensive Merit Personnel Act of 1978 Council Review Period Temporary Amendment Act of 1992

history.narrative: Law 9-87, the “District of Columbia Government Comprehensive Merit Personnel Act of 1978 Council Review Period Temporary Amendment Act of 1992,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 9-387. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on December 17, 1991, and January 7, 1992, respectively. Approved without the signature of the Mayor on January 30, 1992, it was assigned Act No. 9-150 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 9-87 became effective on March 24, 1992.
